lines:
lonz

16 January, 1918.

Mr. S. 8. Kan 
39 Fodorboro St,

Boa ton, Mass.

y dear Kwan:

Many thanks for your good note. Don'ů apologize;

as I have already sold you, the hiene rests on me and not on

you.

By all means look me up when you come out for that

veok-ond on the guth and 27th.

I want to talk syor your play

with you and several other matters as well, including that in -
sxhaus tible topic of conversation, Tommy Lee.

Thank you sincerely for sending me the date of the

Chinese New Year.

Iver yours,
raw: lonz 16 January, 1918. Mr. S. 8. Kan 39 Fodorboro St, Boa ton, Mass. y dear Kwan: Many thanks for your good note. Don'ů apologize; as I have already sold you, the hiene rests on me and not on you. By all means look me up when you come out for that veok-ond on the guth and 27th. I want to talk syor your play with you and several other matters as well, including that insxhaus tible topic of conversation, Tommy Lee. Thank you sincerely for sending me the date of the Chinese New Year. Iver yours,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter welcoming Kwan's visit on February 26-27 and proposing a conversation about Kwan's play, Tommy Lee, and other topics.
metadata.note_acquisition: Phillips Academy Archives and Special Collections received the letters and materials of Sung Sing Kwan from Alfred E. Stearns in ____(date)
metadata.note_preferred-citation: From The Trustees of Phillips Academy.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
